requirement.topic: All messages sent to xmlBlaster use the publish method

description.p: The publish() method allows to send messages to xmlBlaster or in point to point (PtP) mode route messages to other clients.

tr.td: A structure containing an XML key, an XML QoS and the binary message content (see MessageUnit link below)
An XML based return string containing status and other informations (see PublishReturnQos link below)

ul.li: publishArr() Publishes many messages in a bulk
publishOneway() Publishes many messages in a bulk without a return value (without synchronous ACK)

example.pre: <qos> < <state id='OK' info='Keep on running"/> <sender>Tim</sender> <priority>5</priority> <subscriptionId>subId:1</subscriptionId> <rcvTimestamp nanos='1007764305862000002'> <!-- UTC time when message was created in xmlBlaster server with a publish() call, in nanoseconds since 1970 --> 2001-12-07 23:31:45.862000002 <!-- The nanos from above but human readable --> </rcvTimestamp> <topic><expiration lifeTime='129595811'/></topic> <expiration lifeTime='129595811'/> <isVolatile>false</isVolatile> <queue index='0' of='1'/> <!-- If queued messages are flushed on login --> <isDurable/> <readonly/> <redeliver>4</redeliver> <route> <node id='heron'/> </route> </qos>
